creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: somewhat abstracted landscape: densely foliaged rock formation with bands of irregularly shaped clouds; tiny figure seated on top of rocky outcropping just R of center; treetops under fog just below center; tiny hut on cliff bottom center with other irregular rock formations with dense foliage on bottom; inscription URQ
inscription: 求食無餘粒衣無ー絲　是吾衣食道獨楽誰期 {?} (Seeking food without a grain too much / Wearing threadbare clothing / My manner of dress and eating / Who can have pleasure alone?) [Rhiannon Paget]
markings: poem UR red seal: 〇〇 [unread #2]; LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō}[Fukuda Seikō #2], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #3]; LLC red seal: 拙居 {sekkyo}
title: Abandoning my Oars in the Pure Valley
